TopicTitle: Photo of venus I captured with my Mobile phone.

Articles.Content:
Warning, large image.

Reddit link, for everyone who thinks it deserves an upvote.

http://www.reddit.com/r/pics/comments/rdbrh/i_captured_this_photo_of_venus_using_my_cell_phone/
Does your phone have really good zoom or is it that visible? :u
Venus and Jupiter atm are really bright and can be seen even in heavily light polluted areas. It\'s in the western sky right now right after sunset and I can see it from my back yard in the city.
Here\'s the entire conjunction. Venus is up top, then Jupiter is closer to the moon. Taken from a Canon T2i.

This is amazing....

I can\'t even find them with a telescope.

This is amazing....

I can\'t even find them with a telescope.

Thats because they are close to each other (conjuntion).

Also mars venus conjuntion.

I live in a small town in Arizona so there\'s no city and therefore no lights. So I looked outside and after 20 or so seconds I think I pinpointed Venus.

It stuck out from the rest for being slightly brighter and being more of a orange color than any other star.

And if Jupiter is near the moon this must be Jupiter

I managed to capture a godawful picture of the moon with my telescope and a webcam:

I\'d try for venus but it\'d just come out as a white dot.

I managed to capture a godawful picture of the moon with my telescope and a webcam:

I\'d try for venus but it\'d just come out as a white dot.

\'There\'s something blocking half the moon it looks like...
Tonight, i better get out my telliscope/camera combo attack. get some pics.

I remember when I was really young, my dad took me to an observatory with one of them massive telescopes.

It was really late at night, and there were a lot of people queing to look through the telescope.

The telescope was pointed at mars.

It looked like a small red dot in a massive black background.

That was a nice day.
